intro: Anogra leucotricha, commonly known as the white-haired anogra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow to orange in color, with tubular florets surrounding a central disk. Anogra leucotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
